text: Ángel Carrasco Nolasco (1907 – 11 June 1943) was a Spanish Socialist Workers' Party politician. He fought in the Spanish Civil War on the side of the Second Spanish Republic. After the Nationalist victory, he was executed by the government of Francisco Franco. ==References== * NÚÑEZ, Mirta y ROJAS, Antonio, Consejo de Guerra. Los fusilamientos en el Madrid de la posguerra (1939-1945), Madrid, Compañía Literaria, 1997. . * GARCÍA MÁRQUEZ, José María: Golpe militar, resistencia y represión (1936-1950). 2ª edición, 2008. Ed. Fundación FUDEPA. , pág. 94. Category:1907 births Category:1943 deaths Category:Spanish Socialist Workers' Party politicians Category:Spanish military personnel of the Spanish Civil War (Republican faction) Category:People executed by Francoist Spain
title: Ángel Carrasco Nolasco
